Description: Redware vase with a globular body, narrow base and a flaring neck with externally modelled rim. A fine red slip has been applied to the surface.
Curator's comments: The slender tall-necked jar, of this form but with a handle, is found in burials at Deir el-Medina (Nagel, La céramique du Nouvel Empire à Deir el Médineh (DFIFAO 10), 54 [2] and in houses at Tell el-Amarna (Peet and Woolley, City of Akhenaten I, pl.LI [1056]).)
